title: MSG: The Most Misunderstood Seasoning
description: A quick, practical guide to MSG: The Most Misunderstood Seasoning.

hook.text: MSG was vilified for decades. Science says it's safe, natural, and found in Parmesan and tomatoes.

buildup.text: Monosodium glutamate was isolated by Japanese chemist Kikunae Ikeda in 1908 from seaweed broth.

discovery.text: MSG triggers umami receptors â€” the fifth taste â€” making food taste richer, deeper, and more savory.

twist.text: 'Chinese Restaurant Syndrome' was based on one anecdotal letter in 1968. No study has ever confirmed it.

climax.text: FDA, WHO, and every major food authority classify MSG as safe. The stigma was always cultural, not scientific.

punchline.text: MSG is just umami in a shaker. The fear was never real.
